intro: Chorispora greigii, commonly known as Greig's chorispora, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with small, oval-shaped leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Chorispora greigii is well adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
